documents.document: FT: Dublin 1-12 Meath 0-9. Man of the Match Con O'Callaghan scored 1-7 for the Dubs
Great response by 14-man Dublin who have kicked 0-3 without reply and lead 1-10 to 0-8 after 54 minutes
47 mins: Dublin down to 14 men, Martin Cahilan sent off on a second yellow card. Daire Rowe points resulting free. Dublin 1-8 Meath 0-8
46 mins: Dublin 1-7 Meath 0-7. Just one point each so far in the second half. Dublin playing with a strong winds at their back
@seanmacdonnacha Looked to me that Daniel O'Neill was picking up Deegan Skinny, but yep, big Ashbourne involvement. Close game
HT:Dublin 1-6 Meath 0-6.Goal by Con O'Callaghan with the last action of the half. Important goal as Meath had scored three in-a-row before.
23 mins:Dub 0-5 Meath 0-3.Interesting that former Ratoath club & school mates Gavin McGowan(Mh) & Glenn O'Reilly(Dub) are marking each other
@Brian_OCe updates now on LMFM
14 mins: Dublin 0-3 Meath 0-2. Joey Wallace has gone off for Meath, Caolan O'Halligan has come in.Dubs have also had two decent goal chances
@Brian_OCe nope, not live that I can see anyway
7 mins: Dublin 0-1 Meath 0-1
Dublin make one change to starting team here in Parnell Park - Brian Howard for Dara Mullin https://t.co/QQEBDVFqIU
@DavidSSport I'm quite fearful........but it's the hope that kills you
@DavidSSport time will tell whether that's a blessing or a curse
Less than 15 mins to go before Dublin v Meath in @gaaleinster U21 FC. https://t.co/fgd68SKNXe
RT @georgedockrell: The view from the ground isn't too bad #ðŸ˜³ #Himalayas #views #Dharamshala #India #T20WC https://t.co/uoYvS5TCyx
Normal sight of a Monday night -came across this lad strolling (rolling) through Dublin earlier.Johnny Five's alive https://t.co/Sf6CpRkkyt
@condrof not bringing finals forward was a big blow for plans to sort out fixtures, but as regards motions that passed yeh Mark the main one
RT @IrishSunSport: National Football League: SunSport's Team of the Week #GAA https://t.co/fJKHizHRrh https://t.co/JzYkQMgNyO
@condrof more didn't get through though incl bringing All-Ireland finals forward two weeks & having extra-time in most drawn champ games
@condrof Minor going to U17 in hurling & football, U21 going to U20 in football, Christy Ring winners go straight to Leinster SHC that year
RT @IrishSunSport: #AllianzLeagues highlights: Wins for @officialdonegal, @DubGAAOfficial and @Kerry_Official https://t.co/jnoI5vIzYz httpsâ€¦
Meath lose to Cavan,Liverpool lose to MC,Ireland lose to Eng & Congress ensures GAA club players always lose.Enda thinks his weekend was bad
@GOF82 @rte can only go on the coverage I've seen on TV and heard on radio. Massive undertaking and IMO it's been comprehensive
Election coverage by @rte today and yesterday has been excellent .
@BarMcK2 all good as well, but in Meath we're merely dreaming of not losing to the Dubs by double figures again
@ponyyelof he has it all Cliona - accuracy, workrate and well able to look after himself in a battle
@BarMcK2 yep, decent start to the year for ye Bar. Hope all is well
Late Brogan point wins it for Dublin but honestly don't think there's a better inside forward in Ireland than Conor McManus #skill #fighter
Four motions to go at Congress - four additional minutes to be played at the King Power...........the drama of it all
@brenmurph @SmythAla high fielding was never exactly part of my game Murph - yours either!!!!! #PutItInLow
Motion passed that Christy Ring Cup winners be permitted to play in the Leinster SHC 1/4 finals in that calendar year:For 80.3%Against:19.7%
@cormacpro @PaulRouseUCD There's no doubt it carries weight with the GAA fraternity
@LarryManninglm so long as it doesn't slow the game down, Lar
@cormacpro @PaulRouseUCD ??
Motion to open up (allow) all county grounds to host other sports has been strongly defeated. For: 23.5% Against: 76.5%
Motion for all live champ games shown on free to air TV defeated:84.7% Against 15.3% For. GAA free to negotiate with subscription providers
@tombomb79 club and county. Introduced for 2016 Champ unless Central Council decide to hold off until 2017. Kickouts caught between 45s
@SmythAla I hope this doesn't impact on your imminent return to play with either Sydney Shamrocks or Bondi Gaels #TheBallinloughBomber
RT @AIDOXI: Good God! ! #GAAcongress16
The Mark will be introduced to gaelic football - just squeezing a two thirds majority 68% to 32%. A big decision on the future of football.
We're back, after Frank Murphy's technical Rules Advisory Committee motions (which all passed) debate has started about introducing The Mark
@condrof the last 20 motions - all very technical stuff though, proposals by the Rules Advisory Committee. Frank Murphy doing the talking.
@shaneminihane ha, true Corky. Perhaps it's time the humble club player went on strike
Motion to abandon inter-county JFC lost as well. 61% yes 39% no. Enda Kenny & Joan Burton not the only ones having a tough morning
@nickowalsh plenty of talk, but on the evidence of these votes there is not much appetite for action
GAA now fail to get All-Ireland IHC abolished. Central Council are having a Labour/Fine Gael kind of day right now #notgettingmuchsupport
Motion to have extra-time in most champ games lost,fails to get two thirds. 57.5% yes, 42.5% no.No appetite to make space for club fixtures?
@pat_nolan @JohnFogartyIrl @lanno10 But the game's in Twickenham, Pat........... Enjoy watching the Super Reds #InKloppWeTrust
@nickowalsh @gaelicplayers true Nicholas, everybody saying fixtures need sorting out, but when it comes to a vote the status quo remains
Motion lost. 60.8% yes, 39.2% no - fails to get two thirds. All-Ireland finals won't be moved - big blow to overall GAA plans on fixtures
Big vote coming up, @JohnFogartyIrl and @lanno10 on tenterhooks #Congress https://t.co/lOpZK8949G
Galway, Cork and Kilkenny all speaking out against bringing the All-Ireland finals forward. Three big hitters
GAA Congress getting down to the serious stuff early - debate now taking place on moving All-Ireland finals forward. Vote to follow
RT @DeclanBogue: @Gordon_Manning @RuairiOgCdall press event tonight @6.15 - spread the word.

FT: Waterford 0-14 Kilkenny 0-10
65 mins: Waterford 0-12 Kilkenny 0-9. Kilkenny reduced to 14 men, Colin Fennelly sent off on a second yellow card
50 mins: Waterford 0-11 Kilkenny 0-8.
@standavid10 yep the ball is sticking to the ground like a magnet to a fridge door. It's heavy going out there
HT: Waterford 0-8 Kilkenny 0-6. Waterford with 11 wides in the first half, Kilkenny with three
24 mins/ Kilkenny 0-5 Waterford 0-5. But more importantly Walsh Park PA has announced that an E-Cigarette has been handed in
15 mins: Waterford 0-4 Kilkenny 0-4. Waterford playing Darragh Fives as a sweeper.
Waterford have just given All-Ireland champs Kilkenny a guard of honour here at Walsh Park. Expect the civilities to end there #gaa
Hero https://t.co/eQT9wVnWI6
@FERMANAGHRAZ I reckon there will be promotion and relegation spots still to be finalised entering the last round of games
@FERMANAGHRAZ hard to argue with that Raz - you boys are taking the game too seriously ðŸ˜‰
@DavidSSport they had built some good momentum through the O'Byrne Cup so it's a pity they couldn't get to the league break unbeaten
Meath's inconsistency harming their promotion aim again.They've yet to win 4 straight games in Div 2 2015:L,W,W,D,L,W,W 2014:W,L,L,D,W,W,W

@olivermurphy4 plenty of off the ball stuff Ollie. Not sure what it looks like on TV, but entertaining to watch here
HT: Dublin 0-4 Mayo 0-3. Low on scoring but high on tetchiness here in Castlebar
3 mins: Philly McMahon gets a black card for a foul on Aidan O'Shea. McMahon missed Dublin's first game through suspension.Mayo 0-1 Dubs 0-0
Team changes: Dublin - E O Conghaile & P McMahon in, Davy Byrne & C O'Sullivan out. Mayo - M Hall for J Gibbons. https://t.co/l861fygxVh
DJ update from Castlebar: Gone from Bowie to a largely traditional Irish music set - incl Finnegan's Wake & Dirty Old Town. #MoreBowiePlse
Less than an hour to go before @DubGAAOfficial and @MayoGAA lock horns again. Their clashes are rarely uneventful https://t.co/CG2oehm5W7
@regobri I hope you brought the warm gear Brian!!!!!!!
